title: geth node starts syncing from the beginning
body:
Hi,
i run geth for goerli like this:

```
          image: gcr.io/prysmaticlabs/prysm/beacon-chain:stable
          args:
            - '--datadir=/data'
            - '--jwt-secret=/jwt/jwt.hex'
            - '--rpc-host=0.0.0.0'
            - '--grpc-gateway-host=0.0.0.0'
            - '--monitoring-host=0.0.0.0'
            - '--execution-endpoint=http://localhost:8551'
            - >-
              --checkpoint-sync-url=https://goerli.checkpoint-sync.ethpandaops.io
            - >-
              --genesis-beacon-api-url=https://goerli.checkpoint-sync.ethpandaops.io
            - '--prater'
            - '--accept-terms-of-use'
```
```
 image: ethereum/client-go:v1.10.25
          command:
            - geth
          args:
            - '--http'
            - '--authrpc.jwtsecret'
            - /root/.ethereum/jwt.hex
            - '--authrpc.addr'
            - 0.0.0.0
            - '--authrpc.vhosts=*'
            - '--http.addr'
            - 0.0.0.0
            - '--ws'
            - '--ws.addr'
            - 0.0.0.0
            - '--ws.origins=*'
            - '--goerli'
            - '--http.vhosts=*'
            - '--http.api=admin,debug,eth,miner,net,personal,shh,txpool,web3'
            - '--syncmode'
            - full
            - '--verbosity=4'
            - '--v5disc'
            - '--nat=extip:xx'
            - '--snapshot=false'
            - >-
              --bootnodes=enode://a24ac7c5484ef4ed0c5eb2d36620ba4e4aa13b8c84684e1b4aab0cebea2ae45cb4d375b77eab56516d34bfbd3c1a833fc51296ff084b770b94fb9028c4d25ccf@xxxx

```

i have started the containers about 90 days ago. Now my hoster had a problem, the VM had no internet for 4 hours and i had to restart the server with the geth container.

Checked the Geth logs and realized, that it is about 90 days behind and syncing again from there.
I have persistet the ~/.ethereum directory and can confirm there are 200GB of files there, so its not a loss of data per se.

What could be the reason that my geth node has to sync from 90 days instead of just from the outage onwards?
kind regards
Philipp

Your node is stopped at the transition point of The Merge Hard Fork. Your last block has TD `10,790,000`, which is exactly the TD to trigger Proof-of-stake upgrade.

And I am not sure `- '--prater'` is the right flag to post-merge network. Could you please ensure both your consensus layer client and execution layer client are all ready for The Merge?

this guide says to run it with --prater for goerli

https://docs.prylabs.network/docs/install/install-with-script
(prater is the right flag for goerli)
Seems abandoned. I guess this ticket is no longer relevant
